2355.verse: وَإِن|And if|58|76|213$تَجْهَرْ|you speak aloud|127|163|10594$بِٱلْقَوْلِ|the word,|84|120|11343$فَإِنَّهُۥ|then indeed, He|125|161|916$يَعْلَمُ|knows|61|97|742$ٱلسِّرَّ|the secret|89|107|11344$وَأَخْفَى|and the more hidden.|161|161|11345$

2346.verse: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

2347.verse: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

2348.verse: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

2350.verse: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

2351.verse: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -

2352.verse: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

2353.verse: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

2354.verse: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

2355.verse: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

2356.verse: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

2357.verse: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

2358.verse: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."

2359.verse: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,

2360.verse: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
